food

Class Food

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Item
      • food.Food
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Fish, Fly, Fruit, Rat, Seeds, Steak

    public abstract class Food
extends Item
    Abstract class such that it can not be instantiated to create food objects. To create a food object instantiate one of the classes which inherit this class. Classes which inherit this will pass arguments into the constructor to set values to its properties unique to the food item. This class inherits from the abstract class Item, which provides methods and functionality to the food items. Food items are consumable. This means food items are stackable, hence are not added to the player's inventory as a new food item if one already exists. The number of uses is simply increased 'stacking' the items in the player's inventory. Durability is equivalent to the number of uses the item has left. Misbehaving pets can not break consumables. Hence can not break food items.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Game.Item

        cost, description, isStackable, name, numUses, restoreType, restoreValue

    • Constructor Detail

      • Food

        public Food()
        Overloaded constructor - creates a demo food item. Used for testing only.

      • Food

        public Food(double restoreValueInput,
            java.lang.String nameInput,
            double costInput,
            java.lang.String descriptionInput)
        Overloaded constructor to set custom values for the food items. Number of uses is by default set to 1, since it is a consumable.
        Parameters:
        restoreValueInput - The amount the food item will affect a pets stat(s) by.
        nameInput - The name the food item will set to.
        costInput - The cost the food item will be set to.
        descriptionInput - The description the food item will be set to.
